description: From Middle English schaftmonde, from Old English sċeaftmund (“a palm, a palm's length”), equivalent to shaft +‎ mound (“hand”).

entries.meaning: An obsolete unit of length defined as 6 inches, which equals 2 palms or 2⁄3 span; today 6 inches equals exactly 15.24 cm. (Before the 12th century, a shaftment was defined as 6+1⁄2 inches.)
Traditionally the width of the fist and outstretched thumb.
examples: A shaftment is the width of the palm and the outstretched thumb.
